info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 19 at 8:29PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Berkshire, northeastern Columbia, northeastern Greene and southern Rensselaer Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 829 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Valatie to Kinderhook to near Coxsackie. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Chatham, Nassau and Castleton-On-Hudson around 835 PM EDT. Kinderhook around 845 PM EDT. Stephentown and Valatie around 850 PM EDT. New Lebanon around 855 PM EDT. Hancock around 900 PM EDT. Pittsfield and New Ashford around 910 PM EDT. Adams and Cheshire around 915 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Brookview, Van Hoesen Station, North Hancock, Cheshire Harbor, Millers Corners, Rossman, Rayville, Otter Hook, Riders Mills and Climax. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 near exit 10. Interstate 87 near exit 21B. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
